Text.Value: Yeah? We'll see 'bout that!

EditorData.AnimationTags: After VO [Goblin] Goes in combat stance <SimonG>
EditorData.NodeContext: We admitted to killing their comrades and threatened to kill them too, but they aren't intimidated and want to kill us.

Text.Value: And why would I do that? I'm a True Soul.
*Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*
I knew we shouldn'tve taken that fancy berry beer. Could've tasted the poison if it hadn't been so sweet.

EditorData.NodeContext: We are hearing the goblin's thoughts. The goblin is despairing because it thinks they would have tasted the poison (and thus the others wouldn't have died) if they hadn't stolen the fancy berry beer.

Text.Value: V-very sorry - I didn't know. I swear I didn't know!

EditorData.NodeContext: They just realised they are talking to someone of higher rank.

Text.Value: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*
You poisoned yourselves. This is Elderberry Beer - goblins are allergic to it.
You! I knew you'd been mucking with our beer! You poisoned us!

EditorData.NodeContext: Spotting the player and accusing them of being the one who poisoned their beer (and comrades)

Text.Value: I did, but I can slit your throat if you'd prefer a quick death.
*A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
You? You're smaller than a worg whelp. Guys - get this idiot!
You, a True Soul? I'd be shakin' in my boots if you were, but all I'm feelin' is the urge to see your guts.

EditorData.NodeContext: We tried to confince them we are of higher rank, but they think the notion is laughable.

Text.Value: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*
Th-this one's all right, lads! Knows nothin' about no poisonin'!
*As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*
Tnak, you're right. Whoever did this could be anywhere by now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Tnak means damn it, pronounced tuh-NACK. Annoyed and disappointed. they think they'll never find the killer.

Text.Value: Or you just thought we'd be stupid enough to believe ya!

EditorData.AnimationTags: After VO [Goblin] Goes in combat stance <SimonG>
EditorData.NodeContext: We gave a lousy excuse and they're seeing right through it. They're going to attack us now.

Text.Value: Consider it a privilege. I could have just gutted you.
And why would I do that? I'm a True Soul.
*The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*
I should have ripped your arms off!
Could've done a lot worse. A lot worse.
*The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*
Read his mind.
Read her mind.
You! Outsider! You poisoned us!

EditorData.NodeContext: Spotting the player and accusing them of being the one who poisoned their beer (and comrades)

Text.Value: P-please don't! I won't rat you out, I swear! J-just leave me be.

EditorData.NodeContext: We intimidated them and confessed we killed their comrades, but this goblin doesn't want to risk his own hide for revenge.

Text.Value: What are you... this one's tryin' to control my mind or somethin'!

EditorData.NodeContext: The goblin felt the player poking around in their head and is freaked out and angry.

Text.Value: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*
A-allergic? You mean just the beer can kill us?! G-get out of my way. I need some fresh air.

EditorData.AnimationTags: After VO, [Goblin] need to leave the screen in a hurry <Simon>
EditorData.NodeContext: surprised and scared. We just said goblins are allergic to the beer they've been drinking the whole time.

Text.Value: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*
If I'd poisoned you, do you really think I'd still be here?
You! You poisoned us!

EditorData.NodeContext: Spotting the player and accusing them of being the one who poisoned their beer (and comrades)

Text.Value: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

Synopsis: One of the goblins stops the player and accusses them of poisoning their beer and thus killing some of the goblins.
